docs.lead_paragraph: AT LEAST two major employers on Long Island, Entenmann's Bakery Inc. and the United States Postal Service, are now giving mandatory urine tests to job applicants to weed out users of illegal drugs. And other local employers say they may soon join the growing number of companies nationwide that are relying on the tests, which have raised objections on civil liberties and other grounds. Drug screening has also been proposed for job applicants in many municipalities around the country, including Suffolk County, where two bills on the matter are before the County Legislature. One would require mandatory drug tests for all current and future county employees. The second bill would prohibit mandatory drug tests for both public and private employees in the county, with some exceptions - bus drivers, employees working in defense industries on Federal contracts and health workers such as nurses and doctors.

headline.main: DRUG TESTS BY EMPLOYERS ARE ON THE RISE
